Articles.Content:
I am not sure if this question has been answer, but:

everytime I add a Habital Module to a space craft, I might be adding 1 or 3 Kebals, which might be ok if I want them but

if I just want to build a "say a moon base" and keep it empty then at the end of the day using the current modules I might end up with 15+ Kerbals, all sitting around on a moon.

so, if there a way to add a empty Habital module to a build.
Yup. Crew Manifest Mod - Lets you choose who and how many Kerbals to use.

NeoMorph and Johnno have pretty much given you your options here. If you go the stock route, you'll need a probe core for the command module and RCS and/or a high-efficiency/low-thrust engine like an LV-909 or Poodle to rendezvous, eight radial chutes and a hitchhiker. You don't need a lot for an orbital rescue boat. I've never worked with the Crew Manifest Mod; from what I understand, though, it'll empty your pods out without all that mucking about with fun stuff such as "rescue missions" and "more opportunities for unplanned vehicular disassemblies" and such.
